text.tspan: In addition to the three classes mentioned, there are two other special classes in the
According to official Imperial explanations, the Superior Class exists to provide blood
loyalty to the Emperor and are required to live within the confines of the Oratorio,
where their freedom of movement is strictly controlled. In exchange, they can acquire
advanced knowledge and enjoy a far more prosperous life than any other class in the
Empire. In effect, the Superior Class is an elite class that enjoys a disproportionate
share of the income generated by the commoners and a ruling class that sits at the top
of the food chain, often in the guise of corrupt bureaucrats who don't quite fit the
Slaves are the only class that the Empire officially recognized as having a "status gap."
Slaves are treated much more harshly than the average citizen and are denied humane
treatment in most quarters. Basically, slaves are sourced from prisoners who have
committed felonies, rebels resisting the Empire, and others. Because the slave class is
hereditary, there is rarely a shortage of slaves, but when additional slaves are needed,
they are often forcibly taken from wandering groups outside the Empire. This is
sometimes referred to as "human hunting" within the Empire and is practiced more or
Ordinary citizens, regardless of class, are not allowed to own slaves, which the Empire
explains as a precaution against commoners becoming lazy and not fulfilling their
duties. However, some laborers employed in hazardous labor areas or the clearing of
barren lands may live and work with slaves.
Fidelion's weapons factories design and produce a wide variety
of weapons, primarily based on a single diesel engine. Not only
simple weapons are produced here, but also the Empire's finest
weaponry, the "Titans," such as small bipedal tanks and
The laborers of Fidelion live up to their name and are tasked
with providing labor in various areas. Depending on the job,
they typically work around 15 hours a day. They are
indispensable to Fidelion and ensure its various facilities run
Slaves are primarily made up of rebels and criminals who have rebelled
against the Empire or people who have been kidnapped from villages or
wandering groups. Unsurprisingly, slave quarters are often much less
well-fed and well-behaved than other areas, and access to them is often
severely restricted. Slaves typically work harder than workers and
sometimes die in the course of their labor. Unsurprisingly, there are no
These camps are used to train and harden Fidelia's soldiers, who are
selected from the citizenry on a somewhat irregular basis and without age
restrictions. The intensity of the training is too harsh for the average
person to accept, which is why it's the site of many casualties. However, it
is not uncommon for civilians to volunteer for military camps, as the
welfare of soldiers is no worse than that of ordinary workers. The soldiers
who complete their training at the camps are considered the strongest
troops in Texas, unrivaled by any outside force.
One of Fidelia's few forms of entertainment involves gladiators
fighting for their lives — once a week. Defeat in the Arena, no
matter the game, is almost always fatal. For slaves, it was often the
only way to rise in status and gain wealth, and many of them
signed up to fight in the Arena. However, most were forcibly
Smoldering and constantly extracting oil 365 days a year,
Fidelion symbolizes the entire Fidelian Empire and its flagship
oil extraction facility. It is also Jake's residence; only high-
ranking subjects, such as his generals and top scientists, can live
Fidelia's Great Gate is the only entrance to the city.
The gate was built to serve a defensive purpose, protecting the Empire from outside forces,
but its grandeur was also intended to show the outside world the Empire's majesty.
